messages.content: I'm really proud of Canterbury and care passionately about the city that has been my home for the past 20 years. I gave birth to my two sons here, at our own Kent and Canterbury Hospital. I'm not your typical politician. I've been a teaching assistant in local schools and have worked and volunteered with local charities, churches, arts and parents' groups. Like you, I've seen the disastrous effect that austerity policies have had on our jobs, schools, hospitals and social care. I'm standing as your Labour candidate to call a halt to politics-as-usual. It's time for change. Our children need to have the best education they can, to be able to afford decent homes and to have secure health care at all ages. I've spoken with many people struggling to make ends meet and fearful about the future. We need to give them, and all of us, something better. I ask you to vote for hope and a real change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase funding for NHS and social care services.
Make housing more affordable for residents.
Ensure high-quality education accessible to everyone.
Create job opportunities for the local community.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A New Work on Climate Change
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Implement initiatives to tackle climate change.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Brexit that Works for All
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support a Brexit deal that benefits everyone.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour on course to overtake Conservatives

issues.brexitEurope: A Brexit that Works for All
issues.education: Our children need to have the best education they can.
issues.environment: A New Work on Climate Change
